headline: Why The Semrush (SEMR) Story Is Shifting After Adobe’s US$12 Per Share Cash Offer
summary: The latest update on Semrush Holdings keeps fair value effectively locked to the agreed US$12.00 per share cash offer, with only very small tweaks to the underlying discount rate and long term revenue growth assumptions. Supporters of the deal point to the competitive sale process and see the US$12.00 level as a sort of anchor that reflects what buyers are currently willing to pay, while critics argue that this price leaves limited room for longer term upside. Stay tuned to see how you can...
